channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns
item.description:
A critical improper input validation vulnerability in Adobe Commerce and Magento, tracked as CVE-2025-54236, is being actively exploited in the wild. Dubbed 'SessionReaper,' the flaw allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to hijack user sessions via the REST API, leading to potential web shell de...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: APT-C-60 Escalates 'SpyGlace' Campaign Against Japan
item.description:
The South Korea-aligned cyber-espionage group APT-C-60 has significantly intensified its campaign against Japanese organizations in the third quarter of 2025. According to JPCERT/CC and Cyble, the group has deployed at least three new versions of its custom 'SpyGlace' backdoor. The attackers have ev...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: DDoS Attack on Russian Food Agency Cripples National Supply Chains
item.description:
Russia's federal agency for veterinary and phytosanitary surveillance, Rosselkhoznadzor, has been targeted by a large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack starting October 22, 2025. The attack crippled the agency's critical electronic certification systems, including the 'Mercury' platf...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Critical Industries Skyrocket by 34%, KELA Reports
item.description:
A new report from cyber intelligence firm KELA reveals a staggering 34% year-over-year increase in ransomware attacks targeting critical industries between January and September 2025. These vital sectors, including manufacturing, healthcare, and energy, accounted for half of all 4,701 recorded globa...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticat...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: DHS Breach: 'CitrixBleed 2.0' Zero-Day Exposes FEMA & CBP Employee Data
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Citrix NetScaler Gateway, dubbed 'CitrixBleed 2.0' (CVE-2025-5777), was exploited to breach the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The attack, which began in June 2025, compromised the personal and employment data of staff at the Federal Emergency Management A...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT Salt Typhoon Targets European Telecom with SNAPPYBEE Backdoor
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Salt Typhoon has been observed targeting a European telecommunications firm by exploiting a known Citrix NetScaler vulnerability for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deployed a backdoor known as SNAPPYBEE (or Deed RAT) using DLL side-loading techniqu...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →
